column5: I heard a rumor that this year you are not allowed to take nightcrawlers packed in bedding into Canada this year. Can anyone set me straight on this please? Thanks.

I haven't heard this and I was planning on taking a few dozen crawlers through Fort Frances in July. I have always heard that if you are tranporting crawlers they have to be in bedding. Depending on the time you are going over the border, I know there is a bait shop in Fort Frances.
Instead of listening to rumors go read it for yourself.http://www.mnr.gov.on.ca/MNR/fishing/gen.html
No problem with crawlers. Check the regs yourself though. There are new lake specific rules every year. "If you fail to plan................you plan to fail"

[font size="1" color="#FF0000"]LAST EDITED ON Mar-09-01 AT 07:16AM (CST)[/font][p]Good point, Jesse. I went to the site and printed out a copy for my own reference. I learned a lot. Be sure to read it before you plan your trip. If you still have some questions regarding the law, contact the OMNR and ask them.good fishing to you all.
thanks for the great info on the website address. i'm printing it off for reference. once again this site proves to be a valuable resource.tight lines and good fishing!
read april 2001 issue of in-sider. FISHING CANADA by Bob Cruse. worms & crawlers permitted only if packed in commercial bedding (buss bedding) etc. BRU-MAN
